intro: Sylphia turrialbae, commonly known as the Turrialba sylphia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that typically bloom in clusters. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a glossy, dark green appearance. Sylphia turrialbae is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and understory habitats.
